intro: Hieracium laevigatum subsp. grandidens, commonly known as the smooth hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and alternate leaf arrangement. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–50 cm, with basal leaves that are lanceolate and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped cluster, blooming from late spring to early autumn. It is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, and is noted for its ability to spread through rhizomes and seed dispersal.
